question_stem:
What is the output of the following code snippet?

from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

y_true = [1, 0, 1, 1, 0]
y_pred = [1, 0, 0, 1, 1]
print(accuracy_score(y_true, y_pred))
question_stem_html:
What is the output of the following code snippet?

from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score

y_true = [1, 0, 1, 1, 0]
y_pred = [1, 0, 0, 1, 1]
print(accuracy_score(y_true, y_pred))

choices.text: There will be an error message because no model has been fitted.
choices.explanation: The function only requires a `ytrue` and a `ypred` array. It will still run as per normal.

Correct - accuracy is the number of correct predictions (3) divided by the number of 
  total predictions made (5).
